page.title: 02Westerhope, then and now.
page.content: We interviewed two people who have lived in Westerhope all of their lives, Mrs Heppell and Mrs Robson. We found out that they both had similar views about the old and new Westerhope. Westerhope had very few houses earlier in the 1900's and no large housing estates. This meant that most of the land was used for farming but there were also some large market gardens. The old Westerhope was much quieter with no vandalism while Westerhope today has some vandalism and Stamfordham Road is a busy and noisy main road. They both thought that the people were closer and friendlier in the old Westerhope. The new Westerhope however, does have lots of modern facilities which weren't there in the past.
